column4: i just got an old PIII 800 MGHZ and 300 MB of ram, and i want to make it server, beside ssh server and http server there is any other useful tool?
what is an cluster and what is an NAS device
oh man you can make the server do anything
you can make web access servers, you can make ldap servers, ftp servers, streaming media servers
you can spend a lifetime building super cool things :)
its basically a really really fancy address book you can use to authenticate users against and provide priviledges to them
there any way to make a file server, like i have 5 computers and i want them to share files two of them have windows
yes i'll show you the really easy way
1. research what vmware is ... in particular you will need to know what vmware player is and what vmware server is
2. you will download a vmware appliance image ... and run it from your vmware server when you have that setup ... which is easy but a bit hard for a noob, you need to google a bit
do you want me to install the vmware server?

in order to run the vmware appliance images, you will need to install vmware server 1.x which is free to use (though not open source.  later you can use something like xen to do virtualization when you are more comfy with how things work)
i can't hand hold you through the whole thing.  i gave you the shortest route to the most interesting way to test out linux environments, particularly server level stuff
